comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: quizangel.com

labels.name: T: Analytics
labels.description: Collecting analytics and tracking users

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

-

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

`https://quizangel.com/`

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

`https://quizangel.com/`

The "Start" button has `utm` parameters.
`https://quizangel.com/how-well-do-you-know-me/play/3357?utm_site_source=start&utm_site_medium=home&utm_site_campaign=user`

I propose:
```adb
||quizangel.com^$removeparam=utm_site_source
||quizangel.com^$removeparam=utm_site_medium
||quizangel.com^$removeparam=utm_site_campaign
```

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: marvel.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.49.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.marvel.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### Affected site:
`https://www.marvel.com/
`
### Issue:
Embedded videos are blocked.

### Example:
`https://www.marvel.com/tv-shows/werewolf-by-night/1/`

### Screenshot:

![filterissue-marvel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9382674/236858231-14457d80-d308-4108-8087-eb2c288d9938.jpg)

### Problem filters:
* **AdGuard Annoyances filter**
* **AdGuard Tracking Protection filter**

### Elaboration:
Somehow the issue seems to be caused by a very specific combination of rules, found in **AdGuard Annoyances filter** and **AdGuard Tracking Protection filter**.
Despite a buch of attempts, I wasn't able to pinpoint the exact problem combo.
I WAS able to fix it by allowing several connections though, while also allowing and accepting the cookie popup..
Only problem is that allowing that cookie popup shouldn't be necessary, as the videos are displayed just fine without it, when using **EasyList – Cookie Notices** and/or **I don't care about cookies**.

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v112.0.2-1 (x64) [Tracking Protection = Standard]
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.49.2

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

Considering the fixed-width Wikipedia version was an atrocity that should never have been introduced, I for one feel that users would want to know about the full-width version.

Though for all I know, the AdGuard Annoyances Filter team may or may not choose to block the prompt.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.abante.com.ph/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.abante.com.ph%2F) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > Various ads, some of them video ads. I propose: > ``` > ! https://www.abante.com.ph/#gsc.tab=0 (Screenshot 1) > abante.com.ph#?#section nav ~ section:has(img[width="800"]) > abante.com.ph#?#section nav ~ section:has(.attachment-large) > abante.com.ph#?#.elementor-col-50:has(div[data-settings*=autoplay]) > ||www.abante.com.ph/wp-content/uploads/elementor/thumbs^ > ||imgs1.abante.com.ph/video/*.mp4^ > ||www.abante.com.ph/wp-content/uploads/*.gif$image > ||abante.com.ph/wp-content/uploads/*-1024x1024$image > ! https://www.abante.com.ph/2023/05/02/giants-nanliit-kontra-astros/ (2023-05-02) > abante.com.ph#?#.elementor-col-33 div[data-element_type=widget]:has(div[data-settings*=autoplay]) > ``` > The site has the heaviest use of Elementor element names I've ever seen, but I think I got close enough to something that works well enough above. > > The site appears to be fully in Filipino/Tagalog. > > The site has 793,000 monthly visits according to [SimilarWeb](https://www.similarweb.com/website/abante.com.ph/#overview). ### Screenshots

SHAREit, Snaptube, Vanced, Pure Tuber and OiTube Ads

Hello Adguard Team

this list will block the annoying apps Ads
